question: You really can't wait, aren't you?
You've never been ashamed about anything you've ever done?

answer: I don't -- well, let's go private.
question: You mean publicly or privately?

answer: Well, because I was young and dumb.
question: Why?
But if you are 40 -- are you about that age?

answer: I just turned 46, but I'll take the first guess.
question: May I ask?

answer: Well, I think I must, you know.
question: Do you ever fear death yourself?
You are afraid of flying, aren't you?
Was there something that sparked it?

answer: Well, because what they discovered later on is that the people on the plane were aware that they were in some danger, but I think the person who was in the smaller plane had had a heart attack.
question: Why is it so hard?

answer: I had a course from the folks at virgin.
question: You had a course, didn't you?
Do you have other things that you're worried about?

answer: Well, I don't like anything that has a weird consistency.
question: What foods?
You can't drink milk and you can't eat cream corn?

answer: I'm not and I want to be clear, I love corn.
question: Why do you hate a cream corn?

answer: Again, I appreciate the people who grow it and people --
question: You hate spinach?

answer: No, no, no, I mean potato chips from the bag.
question: You just live off fries?
You're really quite weird, aren't you?

answer: Cream corn is going to kill you.
question: Isn't it great?
Do you think you were in love with all your husbands?
It's an amazing thing to say, isn't it?
You won't -- you have church weddings?

answer: Because I wanted to feel normal.
question: Why did you do it if you weren't in love with them?
How my times have you been in love?
Can I chuck a name in?
Is that the man I'm talking about?
Would we know who the person is?
You wish you'd married that person?

answer: Because what I know now is I don't want to live with -- I don't want to live with anyone.
question: Why?

answer: OLDBERG: I don't know if I did.
question: Didn't you like being in love?
Do you think that guy knows he's the only man you've ever loved?

answer: Yes, we talk all the time.
question: You still talk to him?
Are you -- are you on the dating scene?

answer: Well, you know, I'm not surprised by it because, you know, very few presidents can go on and make the change they want to make.
question: Are you disappointed that President Obama, who I know you're a massive fan of and supported, hasn't really done that much for gay marriage?

answer: Well, listen, we didn't tip over the edge, in spite of the fact that, you know, everybody is saying, oh, he hasn't done anything.
question: Do you think we're getting there perhaps?

answer: Going to take a little break now you're nicely fired up.
question: You were raised well by intelligent people for the most part, both of us, and that we know how to say to someone, would this bother you if I did that?
What do you say to that?
Do you actually -- are you friends with the other co- stars of "The View"?
Or are they co-workers that you have to get on with?
Often you looked like you haven't got the patience when you're out there with them?
Don't you find Charlie Sheen's thing fascinating?
You had a problem with drugs, didn't you?

answer: No, you know what, these are such personal issues.
question: Whatever you want to do?
Isn't it true that when you won your Oscar, you were actually high as a kite?
You've become really quite squeaky clean, haven't you?
What do you want to say?

answer: I didn't mean in a bad way.
question: Am I done?

answer: No, no, no, I never did.
question: Did you ever think you'd be on TV every day giving opinion?

answer: It makes me really, really angry.
question: When you hear Donald Trump go after Barack Obama for where he was born, what do you think about it?
ORGAN: Do you think a lot of people will believe it anyway?

answer: Well, you know, it's not just the politics, you know.
question: Is that the danger of that kind of politics?
How do you think you would have fared as a young celebrity when you first hit the big-time if the Internet had been around?

answer: Well, you know, if a politician is behaving in your view wrongly or if a right-wing cable host, someone like a Bill O'Reilly or Glenn Beck, whack, whack, whack.
question: Who have I slapped around?

answer: Because Michael Phelps is an Olympian athlete.
question: Why not?

answer: I think that drunks say whatever comes into their head.
question: Or do you think that the drink loosens tongues, perhaps?

answer: Once in my life, and I was in public.
question: You've been drunk once in your life?

answer: He's not smoking weed out in the street.
question: You don't think he has any responsibility as a role model?

answer: People -- famous people should consider themselves whatever they want to consider themselves.
question: So, no famous people should ever consider themselves to be role models?
If you're a celebrity, and a few friends of yours have done this, if they sell their wedding for $1 million, are they entitled to privacy?

answer: Well, I wanted to say for those of you out there who disagree with me in terms of being a role model, save your e-mails.
question: What did you want to say?

answer: Yes, as far as I know.
question: Are you going to be there for two more years?
Do you love it so much you want to carry on, or is there a natural shelf life to this thing?
For the next 20 years you'd do that?

answer: You can't take a camel to an oasis and then you say, you can't have a drink.
question: A camel to -- OK, can we just talk about that, a camel to the oasis?

answer: Oh, you know, I've got musicals opening.
question: ORGAN: What's on the horizon for you?
Is America more racist or less racist than, say, 20 years ago from your experience?

answer: Because it just feels like questions to me.
question: Why?

answer: In Donald Trump's defense, I know him quite well, I don't think he's a racist at all.
question: When you question this president, the first president we've ever had of color and you're not sure where he was born and it continues, is that about -- what is that about, really?

answer: I suspect it's about votes, because his poll ratings, the more he hammers this point -- it's probably an anti-Obama vote catching mechanism.
question: Or Bill Clinton?

answer: I just assume it's going to be good times with the family, people that you didn't get to meet because they were gone.
question: Ever thought what heaven might be like when you get up there?
Do you believe in an after life?
Well, no, I mean, it depends -- how do you describe praying?

answer: Not necessarily going to church, but talking to an entity that is not physically there and asking for help.
question: Going to church and stuff?
Do you do that kind of thing?
Do you go to any church?
And it can't be the birth of my kid?
Do you know who Moms Mabley was?
